result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendants pays the fine and costs, successfully completes the sentence, has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause and his pending Racine County criminal cases are dismissed.
Defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Court sentences defendant to serve 1 (one) days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 (one) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $150.00 by 6/15/16.  Court ordered costs and surcharges to be paid by 6/15/16. As to fine and costs, failure to pay will result in the entry of civil judgment.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs, successfully completes the sentence, has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause and his pending Racine County criminal cases are dismissed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Case recalled at 3:35 pm to discuss expungment.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings. For reasons stated on the record, Court informed parties to come back in hour for possible disposition of case. If Court is in jury trial at that time, defendant will be given new date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered all previously ordered conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker
Current: 3223 Fern Drive, Burlington, WI 53105   (Effective: 06-26-2015)
Prior: 4313 Glacier Circle, Waterford, WI 53185
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. For reasons stated on the record, Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defendant has a case in Racine on June 8, 2015. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker
Current: 4313 Glacier Circle, Waterford, WI 53185   (Effective: 04-02-2015)
Prior: 4313 Glacier Circle, Waterford, WI 53185

Defendant Gary Christian Herwig-Tucker in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-2-2015 at 1:30pm
